Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n4enaw0M4l1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/22cecb0af4c1c7d33f27f38a601577b4/tumblr_inline_n4enb9cSfH1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>If you’re as big a fan of stats and charts as we, <strong>Rich</strong>'s <a href="http://bit.ly/1rgYQuV"><strong>TELEMACHUS</strong></a> will change your <em><strong>KSP</strong></em> experience forever. Install the mod and build a craft with the <strong>Telemachus</strong> antenna. From there, you’ll have the option to view several different visualizations through the web. With the right combination of hardware, you can even create your own mission control, as pictured above.</p>

<p>There’s a lot to be found in <strong>Telemachus</strong>, so it’s best that you <a href="http://bit.ly/1rgYQuV"><strong>DOWNLOAD</strong></a> it and see for yourself.</p>
How has this not already been on here?
this is why I want a dual monitor or even tri monitor setup. to have my own mission control!

its way cooler if you get one of your friends to control everything but the pitch and stuff (i say this cause it wouldnt work when i tried it) im not event talking same room im talking 5-10 miles away
Super cool. You can control your vessels remotely from a web browser, and track telemetry data as well. On my dual-monitor setup, I had KSP on the right side and four graphs on the left.
